content:
Hello,
I have a general question on how to use apache2 as web server to run docker-zulip container image.
I want to host docker-zulip container and apache2 on the same physical server.
I am aware of that zulip is designed to be run on nginx.
However, we want to run zulip docker container on apache2 instead.

I only can find how to run docker-zulip container on nginx. (the following article)
https://github.com/zulip/docker-zulip/wiki/Proxying-via-nginx-on-host-machine

However, I can't find any thing that describes on how to run docker-zulip container on apache2.
I have tried to follow a document below on how to run zulip as reverse server on apache2, but when I apply it on docker-zulip container, it didn't work.
https://github.com/qnxor/zulip/blob/master/docs/production/deployment.md#apache2-configuration

Also, I have my owner SSL certificates which I receive from third party.
Thank you so much for taking the time to read my question.

I was able to run docker-zulip contain as a reverse server with apache2 as web server.
However, I don't seem able to create user account?
Can anyone show me how to create user account and admin user account?
Thank you so much for reading my questions.
@jcheng what did you try to create an account? The installer ends with outputting a link you can use, or you can use manage.py generate_realm_creation_link to make a new one.
